newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Australian shot dead in central Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Australian shot dead in central Philippines.

text.p: A 61-year-old Australian was shot dead in a central Philippine city while grappling with a man who had tried to snatch the necklace of his Filipina fiancee, police said on Saturday.
Bono Franco of Melbourne died of a gunshot wound from a .45 calibre pistol on Thursday, Ormoc City police officer Bienvenido Bauncit told Reuters.
Police said Franco and his 22-year old girlfriend were walking towards a bus terminal after visiting the city's police station when two men in a motorcycle tried to snatch the woman's necklace.
Franco had reported to police that he lost a suitcase containing his passport in a restaurant in Ormoc on June 2.
Police said they were now looking for the suspects who fled after the incident.
